env_vars.name: ADB_MYSQL_PORT

env_vars.name: ADB_MYSQL_USER
env_vars.description: Database user for authentication

env_vars.name: ADB_MYSQL_PASSWORD

agentql-mcp.description: Model Context Protocol server that integrates AgentQL data extraction capabilities

env_vars.name: AGENTQL_API_KEY
env_vars.description: API key for AgentQL service

apollo-mcp-server.description: Exposes GraphQL operations as MCP tools for AI-driven API orchestration with Apollo

env_vars.name: APOLLO_GRAPH_REF
env_vars.description: Graph ref (graph ID and variant) used to fetch persisted queries or schema (required if no config file)

env_vars.name: APOLLO_KEY
env_vars.description: Apollo Studio API key for the graph (required if no config file)

arxiv-mcp-server.description: AI assistants search and access arXiv papers through MCP with persistent paper storage

env_vars.name: ARXIV_STORAGE_PATH
env_vars.description: Directory path where downloaded papers will be stored

astra-db-mcp.description: Model Context Protocol server for interacting with DataStax Astra DB

env_vars.description: Astra DB application token for authentication

env_vars.name: ASTRA_DB_API_ENDPOINT
env_vars.description: Astra DB API endpoint URL

env_vars.name: ASTRA_DB_KEYSPACE
env_vars.description: Astra DB keyspace to use (defaults to default_keyspace)

atlassian.description: Connect to Atlassian products like Confluence, Jira Cloud and Server/Data deployments.

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_URL
env_vars.description: Confluence URL (e.g., https://your-domain.atlassian.net/wiki)

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Confluence username/email for Cloud deployments

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Confluence API token for Cloud deployments

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_PERSONAL_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Confluence Personal Access Token for Server/Data Center deployments

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_SSL_VERIFY
env_vars.description: Verify SSL certificates for Confluence Server/Data Center (true/false)

env_vars.name: CONFLUENCE_SPACES_FILTER
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of Confluence space keys to filter search results

env_vars.name: JIRA_URL
env_vars.description: Jira URL (e.g., https://your-domain.atlassian.net)

env_vars.name: JIRA_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Jira username/email for Cloud deployments

env_vars.name: JIRA_API_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Jira API token for Cloud deployments

env_vars.name: JIRA_PERSONAL_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Jira Personal Access Token for Server/Data Center deployments

env_vars.name: JIRA_SSL_VERIFY
env_vars.description: Verify SSL certificates for Jira Server/Data Center (true/false)

env_vars.name: JIRA_PROJECTS_FILTER
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of Jira project keys to filter search results

env_vars.name: READ_ONLY_MODE
env_vars.description: Run in read-only mode (disables all write operations)

env_vars.name: MCP_VERBOSE
env_vars.description: Increase logging verbosity

env_vars.name: ENABLED_TOOLS
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of tool names to enable (if not set, all tools are enabled)

aws-api.description: Enables AI assistants to interact with AWS services and resources through AWS CLI commands

env_vars.name: AWS_REGION
env_vars.description: Default AWS region for CLI commands unless a specific region is provided in the request

env_vars.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
env_vars.description: AWS access key ID for authentication

env_vars.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
env_vars.description: AWS secret access key for authentication

env_vars.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
env_vars.description: AWS session token for temporary credentials

env_vars.name: READ_OPERATIONS_ONLY
env_vars.description: When set to "true", restricts execution to read-only operations

env_vars.name: REQUIRE_MUTATION_CONSENT
env_vars.description: When set to "true", asks explicit consent before executing non-read-only operations

env_vars.name: AWS_API_MCP_WORKING_DIR
env_vars.description: Working directory path for MCP server operations (must be absolute path)

env_vars.name: AWS_API_MCP_ALLOW_UNRESTRICTED_LOCAL_FILE_ACCESS
env_vars.description: When set to "true", enables system-wide file access (may cause unintended overwrites)

env_vars.name: AWS_API_MCP_TELEMETRY
env_vars.description: Allow sending additional telemetry data to AWS related to server configuration

env_vars.name: EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_SCRIPTS
env_vars.description: When set to "true", enables experimental agent scripts functionality

env_vars.name: AWS_API_MCP_AGENT_SCRIPTS_DIR
env_vars.description: Directory path containing custom user scripts for agent scripts functionality

aws-diagram.description: Generate AWS diagrams, sequence diagrams, flow diagrams, and class diagrams using Python code.

env_vars.name: OUTPUT_DIR
env_vars.description: Directory where diagrams will be saved

env_vars.name: FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL
env_vars.description: Logging level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL)

aws-documentation.description: Access AWS documentation, search for content, and get recommendations.

env_vars.name: AWS_DOCUMENTATION_PARTITION
env_vars.description: AWS documentation partition (aws, aws-cn)

env_vars.name: FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL
env_vars.description: Logging level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL)

aws-pricing.description: Generate upfront AWS service cost estimates and cost insights.

env_vars.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
env_vars.description: AWS access key ID with access to the AWS Pricing API

env_vars.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
env_vars.description: AWS secret access key

env_vars.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
env_vars.description: AWS session token for temporary credentials

env_vars.name: AWS_REGION
env_vars.description: AWS region for the Pricing API endpoint (us-east-1, eu-central-1, ap-southeast-1)

env_vars.name: FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL
env_vars.description: Logging level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL)

azure.description: The Azure MCP Server, bringing the power of Azure to your agents.

env_vars.name: AZURE_CLIENT_ID
env_vars.description: Your Azure client ID for authentication

env_vars.name: AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET
env_vars.description: Your Azure client secret for authentication

env_vars.name: HTTP_PROXY
env_vars.description: HTTP proxy URL for outbound requests (optional)

env_vars.name: HTTPS_PROXY
env_vars.description: HTTPS proxy URL for outbound requests (optional)

env_vars.name: NO_PROXY
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of hosts to exclude from proxying (optional)

brightdata-mcp.description: An MCP interface into the Bright Data toolset for web scraping and data extraction

env_vars.name: API_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Bright Data API token for authentication

env_vars.name: RATE_LIMIT
env_vars.description: Rate limiting configuration (format: limit/time+unit, e.g., 100/1h, 50/30m, 10/5s)

env_vars.name: WEB_UNLOCKER_ZONE
env_vars.description: Custom Web Unlocker zone name

env_vars.name: BROWSER_ZONE
env_vars.description: Custom Browser API zone name

env_vars.name: PRO_MODE
env_vars.description: Enable pro mode to access all tools including browser automation and web data extraction

browserbase.description: MCP server for cloud browser automation with Browserbase and Stagehand

env_vars.name: BROWSERBASE_API_KEY
env_vars.description: Browserbase API key

env_vars.name: BROWSERBASE_PROJECT_ID

env_vars.name: GEMINI_API_KEY
env_vars.description: Google Gemini API key for Stagehand

buildkite.description: Connect your Buildkite data (pipelines, builds, jobs, tests) to AI tooling and editors.

env_vars.name: BUILDKITE_API_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Your Buildkite API access token

env_vars.name: JOB_LOG_TOKEN_THRESHOLD
env_vars.description: Token threshold for job logs. If exceeded, logs will be written to disk and returned by path (for local use only).

chroma-mcp.description: MCP server for ChromaDB vector database operations

env_vars.description: ChromaDB server URL

env_vars.name: CHROMA_API_KEY

chrome-devtools-mcp.description: Control and inspect live Chrome browser from AI coding agents with full DevTools access

cloud-run.description: Deploy apps to Google Cloud Run with integrated logging and service management

env_vars.description: Path to Google Cloud credentials JSON file

env_vars.name: GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT
env_vars.description: Google Cloud project ID for deployments

env_vars.name: GOOGLE_CLOUD_REGION
env_vars.description: Default Google Cloud region for deployments

env_vars.name: DEFAULT_SERVICE_NAME
env_vars.description: Default Cloud Run service name

env_vars.name: SKIP_IAM_CHECK
env_vars.description: Skip IAM permission checks (true/false)

context7.description: Context7 MCP pulls version-specific docs and code examples directly into your prompt

env_vars.name: CONTEXT7_API_KEY
env_vars.description: API key for higher rate limits

crowdstrike-falcon.description: CrowdStrike Falcon integration for security analysis, detections, incidents, and threat intel

env_vars.description: CrowdStrike API client ID

env_vars.name: FALCON_CLIENT_SECRET
env_vars.description: CrowdStrike API client secret

env_vars.name: FALCON_BASE_URL
env_vars.description: CrowdStrike API base URL (e.g., https://api.crowdstrike.com, https://api.us-2.crowdstrike.com, https://api.eu-1.crowdstrike.com)

env_vars.name: FALCON_MCP_MODULES
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of modules to enable (detections,incidents,intel,hosts,spotlight,cloud,idp). If not set, all modules are enabled.

env_vars.name: FALCON_MCP_DEBUG
env_vars.description: Enable debug logging - true or false (default: false)

database-toolbox.description: Database operations MCP server with connection pooling, authentication, and observability

dolt.description: Git-like version control for SQL databases with branching, merging, and data versioning

env_vars.name: DOLT_HOST
env_vars.description: Hostname of the Dolt SQL server

env_vars.name: DOLT_PORT
env_vars.description: Dolt server port

env_vars.name: DOLT_USER
env_vars.description: Username for Dolt server authentication

env_vars.name: DOLT_PASSWORD
env_vars.description: Password for Dolt server authentication

env_vars.name: DOLT_DATABASE
env_vars.description: Name of the database to connect to

env_vars.name: MCP_MODE
env_vars.description: Server mode (stdio or http)

env_vars.name: MCP_PORT
env_vars.description: HTTP server port (HTTP mode only)

env_vars.name: ES_URL
env_vars.description: Your Elasticsearch instance URL

env_vars.name: ES_API_KEY
env_vars.description: Elasticsearch API key for authentication

env_vars.name: ES_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Elasticsearch username for basic authentication

env_vars.name: ES_PASSWORD
env_vars.description: Elasticsearch password for basic authentication

env_vars.name: ES_CA_CERT
env_vars.description: Path to custom CA certificate for Elasticsearch SSL/TLS

env_vars.name: ES_SSL_SKIP_VERIFY
env_vars.description: Set to '1' or 'true' to skip SSL certificate verification

env_vars.name: ES_PATH_PREFIX
env_vars.description: Path prefix for Elasticsearch instance exposed at a non-root path

env_vars.name: ES_VERSION
env_vars.description: Server assumes Elasticsearch 9.x. Set to 8 target Elasticsearch 8.x

everything.description: This MCP server attempts to exercise all the features of the MCP protocol

fetch.description: Allows you to fetch content from the web

filesystem.description: Allows you to do filesystem operations. Mount paths under /projects using --volume.

firecrawl.description: Web scraping and content extraction MCP server with advanced crawling and LLM integration

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_API_KEY
env_vars.description: API key for FireCrawl service authentication

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_API_URL
env_vars.description: FireCrawl API URL (default: https://api.firecrawl.dev/v1)

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_RETRY_MAX_ATTEMPTS
env_vars.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for API calls

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_RETRY_INITIAL_DELAY
env_vars.description: Initial delay in milliseconds for retry backoff

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_RETRY_MAX_DELAY
env_vars.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds for retry backoff

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_RETRY_BACKOFF_FACTOR
env_vars.description: Backoff factor for retry delay calculation

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_CREDIT_WARNING_THRESHOLD
env_vars.description: Credit threshold for warning notifications

env_vars.name: FIRECRAWL_CREDIT_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD
env_vars.description: Credit threshold for critical notifications

genai-toolbox.description: Will be removed soon. Please use database-toolbox instead.

git.description: Provides support for interacting with Git repositories

env_vars.name: GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN
env_vars.description: GitHub personal access token with appropriate permissions

env_vars.name: GITHUB_HOST
env_vars.description: GitHub Enterprise Server hostname (optional)

env_vars.name: GITHUB_TOOLSETS
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of toolsets to enable (e.g., 'repos,issues,pull_requests'). If not set, all toolsets are enabled. See the README for available toolsets.

env_vars.name: GITHUB_DYNAMIC_TOOLSETS
env_vars.description: Set to '1' to enable dynamic toolset discovery

env_vars.name: GITHUB_READ_ONLY
env_vars.description: Set to '1' to enable read-only mode, preventing any modifications to GitHub resources

gitlab.description: Provides integration with a GitLab instance to manage projects, issues, merge requests, and more.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Your GitLab personal access token.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_API_URL
env_vars.description: Your GitLab API URL.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_PROJECT_ID
env_vars.description: Default project ID. If set, overwrite this value when making an API request.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_ALLOWED_PROJECT_IDS
env_vars.description: Optional comma-separated list of allowed project IDs. When set with a single value, acts as a default project.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_READ_ONLY_MODE
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', restricts the server to only expose read-only operations.

env_vars.name: USE_GITLAB_WIKI
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', enables the wiki-related tools. By default, wiki features are disabled.

env_vars.name: USE_MILESTONE
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', enables the milestone-related tools. By default, milestone features are disabled.

env_vars.name: USE_PIPELINE
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', enables the pipeline-related tools. By default, pipeline features are disabled.

env_vars.name: GITLAB_AUTH_COOKIE_PATH
env_vars.description: Path to an authentication cookie file for GitLab instances that require cookie-based authentication.

env_vars.name: SSE
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', enables the Server-Sent Events transport.

env_vars.name: STREAMABLE_HTTP
env_vars.description: When set to 'true', enables the Streamable HTTP transport. If both SSE and STREAMABLE_HTTP are set to 'true', Streamable HTTP is used.

grafana.description: Grafana integration for dashboard search, datasource queries, alerting, and incident response

env_vars.name: GRAFANA_URL
env_vars.description: URL of the Grafana instance to connect to

env_vars.name: GRAFANA_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN

env_vars.name: GRAFANA_ORG_ID

mcp-optimizer.description: MCP server that acts as an intelligent intermediary between AI clients and multiple MCP servers

env_vars.name: ALLOWED_GROUPS
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of ToolHive group names to filter tool lookups (default: no filtering)

env_vars.name: MAX_TOOLS_TO_RETURN
env_vars.description: Number of tools to return from find_tool (default: 8)

env_vars.name: TOOL_DISTANCE_THRESHOLD
env_vars.description: Distance threshold for tool similarity (default: 1.0)

env_vars.name: MAX_TOOL_RESPONSE_TOKENS
env_vars.description: Maximum number of tokens to return from call_tool (default: no limit)

env_vars.name: WORKLOAD_POLLING_INTERVAL
env_vars.description: Polling interval for running MCP servers (default: 60 seconds)

env_vars.name: REGISTRY_POLLING_INTERVAL
env_vars.description: Polling interval for ToolHive registry (default: 24 hours)

env_vars.name: RUNTIME_MODE
env_vars.description: Runtime mode for MCP servers (docker or k8s, default: docker)

mcp-redfish.description: Natural language interface for managing infrastructure via Redfish API

env_vars.description: JSON array of Redfish endpoint configurations with address, port, username, password, auth_method, and tls_server_ca_cert

env_vars.name: REDFISH_PORT
env_vars.description: Default port for Redfish API endpoints

env_vars.name: REDFISH_AUTH_METHOD
env_vars.description: Authentication method (basic or session)

env_vars.name: REDFISH_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Default username for Redfish authentication

env_vars.name: REDFISH_PASSWORD
env_vars.description: Default password for Redfish authentication

env_vars.name: REDFISH_SERVER_CA_CERT
env_vars.description: Path to CA certificate for TLS verification

env_vars.name: MCP_TRANSPORT

env_vars.name: MCP_REDFISH_LOG_LEVEL

env_vars.name: FILE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
env_vars.description: Directory for file outputs (optional, used by some tools)

mcp-server-neon.description: MCP server for interacting with Neon Management API and databases

mongodb.description: Provides support for interacting with MongoDB Databases and MongoDB Atlas.

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_CONNECTION_STRING
env_vars.description: MongoDB connection string for direct database connections (optional, if not set, you'll need to call the connect tool before interacting with MongoDB data)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_API_CLIENT_ID
env_vars.description: Atlas API client ID for authentication (required for running Atlas tools)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_API_CLIENT_SECRET
env_vars.description: Atlas API client secret for authentication (required for running Atlas tools)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_API_BASE_URL
env_vars.description: Atlas API base URL (default is https://cloud.mongodb.com/)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_SERVER_ADDRESS
env_vars.description: MongoDB server address for direct connections (optional, used for connect tool)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_SERVER_PORT
env_vars.description: MongoDB server port for direct connections (optional, used for connect tool)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_LOG_PATH
env_vars.description: Folder to store logs (inside the container)

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_DISABLED_TOOLS
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of tool names, operation types, and/or categories of tools to disable

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_READ_ONLY
env_vars.description: When set to true, only allows read and metadata operation types

env_vars.name: MDB_MCP_TELEMETRY
env_vars.description: When set to disabled, disables telemetry collection

env_vars.name: NETBIRD_HOST
env_vars.description: NetBird API host (default is api.netbird.io)

notion.description: Provides integration with Notion APIs through a local Notion MCP Server.

env_vars.name: NOTION_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Notion integration token (ntn_****).

env_vars.name: OPENAPI_MCP_HEADERS
env_vars.description: HTTP headers for Notion API requests in JSON format (advanced use cases). Example: {"Authorization":"Bearer ntn_****","Notion-Version":"2022-06-28"}

oci-registry.description: Secure OCI container registry querying with image introspection and manifest retrieval

env_vars.name: OCI_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Bearer token for OCI registry authentication

env_vars.name: OCI_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Username for registry authentication

env_vars.name: OCI_PASSWORD
env_vars.description: Password for registry authentication

onchain-mcp.description: MCP server for blockchain data interaction through the Bankless API

env_vars.name: BANKLESS_API_TOKEN
env_vars.description: API token for Bankless API authentication

osv.description: OSV (Open Source Vulnerabilities) database access for querying package and commit vulnerabilities

perplexity-ask.description: Integrates Perplexity AI's Sonar API for live web searches, in-depth research, and reasoning tasks.

env_vars.name: PERPLEXITY_API_KEY
env_vars.description: Perplexity API key

phoenix.description: MCP server for Arize Phoenix observability platform

env_vars.name: PHOENIX_API_KEY
env_vars.description: API key for Phoenix authentication

env_vars.name: PHOENIX_BASE_URL
env_vars.description: Base URL for Phoenix instance

playwright.description: Provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright

plotting.description: Provides plotting capabilities for visualizing data in various formats.

postgres-mcp-pro.description: Provides configurable read/write access and performance analysis for PostgreSQL databases.

env_vars.name: DATABASE_URI
env_vars.description: PostgreSQL connection string, like 'postgresql://username:password@host.docker.internal:5432/dbname'

env_vars.name: OPENAI_API_KEY
env_vars.description: OpenAI API key for experimental index tuning by LLM

prometheus.description: Provides access to Prometheus metrics and queries

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_URL
env_vars.description: URL of your Prometheus server

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Username for basic authentication

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_PASSWORD
env_vars.description: Password for basic authentication

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Bearer token for authentication

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_URL_SSL_VERIFY
env_vars.description: Set to False to disable SSL verification

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_DISABLE_LINKS
env_vars.description: Set to True to disable Prometheus UI links in query results (saves context tokens)

env_vars.name: ORG_ID
env_vars.description: Organization ID for multi-tenant setups

env_vars.name: PROMETHEUS_CUSTOM_HEADERS
env_vars.description: Custom headers as JSON string

redis.description: Enables LLMs to interact with Redis key-value databases through a set of standardized tools.

env_vars.name: REDIS_HOST
env_vars.description: Redis IP or hostname (default "127.0.0.1")

env_vars.name: REDIS_PORT
env_vars.description: Redis port (default 6379)

env_vars.name: REDIS_DB
env_vars.description: Redis database number (default 0)

env_vars.name: REDIS_USERNAME
env_vars.description: Redis username (default "default")

env_vars.name: REDIS_PWD
env_vars.description: Redis password (default empty)

env_vars.name: REDIS_SSL
env_vars.description: Redis TLS connection (True|False, default False)

env_vars.name: REDIS_CA_PATH
env_vars.description: CA certificate for verifying server

env_vars.name: REDIS_SSL_KEYFILE
env_vars.description: Client's private key file for client authentication

env_vars.name: REDIS_SSL_CERTFILE
env_vars.description: Client's certificate file for client authentication

env_vars.name: REDIS_CERT_REQS
env_vars.description: Whether the client should verify the server's certificate (default "required")

env_vars.name: REDIS_CA_CERTS
env_vars.description: Path to the trusted CA certificates file

env_vars.name: REDIS_CLUSTER_MODE
env_vars.description: Enable Redis Cluster mode (True|False, default False)

env_vars.name: MCP_TRANSPORT
env_vars.description: Use the stdio or sse transport (default stdio)

semgrep.description: Scan code for security vulnerabilities using Semgrep with 5,000+ semantic analysis rules

env_vars.name: SEMGREP_APP_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Token for connecting to Semgrep AppSec Platform

sentry.description: Sentry MCP service for human-in-the-loop coding agents and developer workflow debugging

env_vars.name: SENTRY_ACCESS_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Sentry user auth token with necessary scopes

env_vars.name: SENTRY_HOST
env_vars.description: Sentry host URL (e.g., sentry.example.com)

env_vars.name: OPENAI_API_KEY
env_vars.description: OpenAI API key for AI-powered search tools (search_events, search_issues)

sequentialthinking.description: Dynamic problem-solving with structured, reflective approach that adapts as understanding deepens

sonarqube.description: Integration with SonarQube Server or Cloud for code quality and security analysis.

env_vars.name: SONARQUBE_TOKEN
env_vars.description: SonarQube user auth token with necessary scopes

env_vars.name: SONARQUBE_URL
env_vars.description: SonarQube Server base URL (required for self-hosted instances)

env_vars.name: SONARQUBE_ORG
env_vars.description: SonarQube Cloud organization key (required for SonarQube Cloud)

env_vars.name: SONARQUBE_TOOLSETS
env_vars.description: Comma-separated list of toolsets to enable (e.g., analysis,issues,quality-gates - see docs)

env_vars.name: SONARQUBE_READ_ONLY
env_vars.description: Set to "true" to disable all write operations

sqlite.description: Provides tools and resources for querying SQLite databases.

stripe.description: Allows you to integrate with Stripe APIs through the Stripe Agent Toolkit.

env_vars.name: STRIPE_SECRET_KEY
env_vars.description: Your Stripe secret API key, available in the Stripe Dashboard.

supabase.description: Connect Supabase projects to AI assistants for table management, config, and data querying

env_vars.name: SUPABASE_ACCESS_TOKEN
env_vars.description: Personal access token from Supabase dashboard

tavily-mcp.description: MCP server for advanced web search using Tavily's AI search engine

env_vars.name: TAVILY_API_KEY
env_vars.description: API key for Tavily search service

terraform.description: Terraform registry and Cloud/Enterprise integration for providers, modules, policies, and workspaces

env_vars.name: TFE_TOKEN
env_vars.description: API authentication token for Terraform Cloud/Enterprise access

env_vars.name: TFE_ADDRESS
env_vars.description: HCP Terraform/Enterprise endpoint URL

env_vars.name: ENABLE_TF_OPERATIONS
env_vars.description: Enable destructive operations (use cautiously in production)

env_vars.name: TFE_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY
env_vars.description: Bypass TLS certificate validation (development only)

env_vars.name: TRANSPORT_MODE
env_vars.description: Protocol selection (stdio or streamable-http)

time.description: Provides time information and IANA timezone conversions with auto system timezone detection.

toolhive-doc-mcp.description: Search ToolHive docs for help with using and contributing to the project (local version)

env_vars.name: OTEL_ENABLED
env_vars.description: Enable/disable OpenTelemetry logging

env_vars.name: OTEL_ENDPOINT
env_vars.description: OpenTelemetry collector endpoint

env_vars.name: OTEL_SERVICE_NAME
env_vars.description: Service name for telemetry

env_vars.name: OTEL_SERVICE_VERSION
env_vars.description: Service version for telemetry

atlassian-remote.description: Atlassian's official remote MCP server for Jira, Confluence, and Compass with OAuth 2.1

aws-knowledge.description: Documentation, code samples, regional availability knowledge, and other official AWS content

canva.description: Canva's official remote MCP server for design creation and template management

context7-remote.description: Remote Context7 MCP server pulls version-specific docs and code examples directly into your prompt

github-remote.description: GitHub's official MCP server for repositories, issues, PRs, actions, and security with OAuth

huggingface.description: Official Hugging Face MCP server for models, datasets, and research papers

jam.description: Jam's official remote MCP server for debugging with video recordings and logs

kiwi.description: Kiwi.com Flight Search MCP server to search and book flights

linear.description: Linear's official remote MCP server to manage issues, projects, and comments

mcp-spec.description: Official MCP server for the Model Context Protocol specification

mermaid.description: Enables AI assistants to create, validate, and render Mermaid diagrams seamlessly

monday.description: Monday.com's official remote MCP server for project and workflow management

neon.description: Neon's official remote MCP server for serverless Postgres with branching and migrations

notion-remote.description: Notion's official remote MCP server for workspaces, pages, databases, and comments

paypal.description: PayPal's MCP server for payment processing, invoices, and business operations

replicate.description: Replicate's official MCP server for AI models and ML workflows

semgrep-remote.description: Official Semgrep MCP server for code security scanning and vulnerability detection

sentry-remote.description: Sentry's official remote MCP server for error monitoring and performance tracking

square.description: Square's official remote MCP server for payment processing and commerce

stripe-remote.description: Stripe's official remote MCP server for payment processing and subscriptions

toolhive-doc-mcp-remote.description: Search ToolHive docs for help with using and contributing to the project (hosted version)

vercel.description: Vercel's official remote MCP server for deployment platform and project management

wix.description: Wix's official remote MCP server for development platform and site management
